experience.title: CFO
experience.description:
Lucidity (formerly known as KR8OS) is a digital advertising blockchain protocol bringing transparency and trust to digital advertising. 

Built on the Ethereum blockchain, Lucidity resolves data discrepancies so billing is faster; prevents fraud by eliminating publisher domain spoofing; and enables supply chain payment tracking so advertisers know exactly where their budgets are going. 

Lucidity was founded to bring total, indisputable transparency to the digital advertising supply chain for a cleaner ecosystem in which honest players can benefit the most.

profile.name: Gaurav Bhasin
profile.headline: Managing Director at Allied Advisers | Founder | Board Advisor | Investor
profile.description:
Allied Advisers is a global technology-focused investment bank. Our clients range from emerging growth companies with dreams to capture the world to a vertical SaaS client whose last round of valuation was $1.5B. At Allied Advisers we have successfully completed technology transactions globally for clients with Fortune 50 buyers and top tier Private Equity firms. Being independent and entrepreneurial allows us to bring the right resources and customize the transaction per client needs.

Gaurav has closed more than 85 transactions (M&A, Financings including structured debt and PE / VC raises, Recapitalization, Strategic Alliances and Divestitures, IPO, Follow-On) representing clients in a broad range of technology sectors including Software (Application Software, Infrastructure Software, Vertical SaaS including Education, FinTech, Health Care, Real Estate Software), Internet (gaming, e-commerce) and Hardware. Gaurav has also closed transactions for emerging technologies companies in Deep Tech incl. AI / ML. His clients have exited to strategics like Apple to Zynga and PE firms such as ClearLake Capital, Francisco Partners, Hercules Capital, K1 Capital, Marlin Equity, Nexphase Capital, PSG, Spotlight PE etc. 

Previously, Gaurav was a Managing Director at Capstone Headwaters and Pagemill Partners, a division of Duff & Phelps Securities.  Gaurav also worked as an investment banker at Banc of America Securities.  Gaurav has successfully completed complex cross-border transactions worldwide including Canada, Europe, India and Israel. One of his transactions led ACQ to recognize the transaction as Cross-Border M&A Advisor of the year. Gaurav started his career as an engineer before moving into management roles. 

Gaurav has MS in engineering from UCLA where he graduated in the top 5% of his class and attended on a full research  fellowship.  He also got an MBA at UCLA while working full-time and graduated with Anderson Honors. 

He is (Series 7, 63 and 79) Licensed. He grew up in India and is conversant in Bengali, Hindi, Punjabi and Urdu. He is also co-author of several published papers in scientific journals. He has invested in companies which exited successfully to Docusign, Nutanix, Luminate PE and several have raised significant uprounds. He is Patron member of Indiaspora, TiE Charter member and Forbes Business council member. 

Gaurav was noted in the top 101 Managing Directors in Finance in San Francisco and in Silicon India top 100 companies founded and managed by American Indians.

profile.name: Francesca Cavallin Mead
profile.headline: Founder and Principal Designer @ SentireDesign | Interior Design
profile.description:
With a resolute focus on crafting elegant residential spaces, my tenure as the Founder and Principal Designer at SentireDesign has been marked by a commitment to design excellence and innovation. Specializing in development design, custom furniture, and space planning, my approach blends a deep understanding of aesthetics with functional precision.

At the helm of SentireDesign, my mission extends beyond creating visually stunning environments; it is about translating clients' visions into tangible realities that elevate their everyday living experience. This dedication to client satisfaction and design integrity is the cornerstone of SentireDesign's reputable standing in the high-end residential design industry.
profile.title: Founder and Principal Designer

experience.title: Founder and Principal Designer
experience.description: As the Owner and Principal Designer of SentireDesign, a boutique interior design studio based in Thousand Oaks, California, I have been creating personalized and functional residential spaces since founding the company in 2012. With a focus on remodels and new construction projects, I work with clients across Pasadena, San Marino, Beverly Hills, Los Angeles, and Ventura County, delivering comprehensive interior design services that include concept development, space planning, material selection, and custom furniture design and procurement. Drawing from my Italian heritage and cultural background, I bring a unique perspective to every project, blending timeless elegance with practical functionality, while collaborating closely with contractors and tradespeople to ensure a seamless execution and exceptional client satisfaction.

profile.name: Dylan Schiemann
profile.headline: Technical strategy and direction with Living Spec, HalfStack, SlateJS, Plate. Prev: SitePen, Dojo, InfoQ
profile.description:
I am currently working on Living Spec, the app specifically crafted to adapt, helping individuals, teams, and organizations carry any project through from messy ideas to final delivery..

As an early adopter and proponent of JavaScript and Open Source web technology, I created software at the helm of SitePen for nearly 20 years. I, along with an impressive team of engineers, have created tools and frameworks to expedite developer progress, advised enterprise leaders on solutions that would define their future success and built complex applications that delighted both the user and the CEO. Surrounded by a passionate team of forward-thinking people, I’m now focused on improving development for the next version of the open web, enabling SitePen’s customers to modernize their apps, tools and teams, and to be ready for what’s to come.

I also organize the HalfStack series of conferences around the world and now online, providing a fun and creative experiences for JavaScript and web developers, designers, and decision makers.

Overall I help make things happen.

profile.name: Karen M Caruso
profile.headline: Educator. Artist. Advocate for People with Disabilities. Co-founder Lola Techsystems, Inc.
profile.description:
Karen M Caruso earned her bachelor’s degree in Fine Arts at the Hartford Art School, then went on to complete a master’s degree in Education at UCLA and another master’s degree  in Psychology at Antioch University. 

As a classroom clinician, mother and stepmother of 3 and veteran National Board Certified LAUSD classroom teacher, Karen specializes in bridging the gap between school and home for her students. Karen has been a relentless researcher informed by her real-world experience in the classroom and as a teacher of teachers in the UCLA Graduate School of Education, Teach LA and Pacific Oaks College Teacher Education Programs.  

In over 3 decades of experience with children, she has developed and directed California Reading Initiative Programs, provided literacy coaching and National Board support programs for teachers through the University of California Los Angeles, served in internships at the Cedars-Sinai Medical Center Teen Line, a program where teens in crisis receive help, and worked with the Julia Ann Singer Center where she treated children and families from abusive home situations. An education activist and community organizer, Karen has drawn from her classroom experiences to fuel her passion for political change within the field of education.

If you need to reach me, use  Lin.wilson@gmail.com
A Transformational Business Leader with demonstrated success ranging from startup to $600M global businesses, achieving and managing revenue goals of up to $200M, operational budgets of up to $65M, and capital expense budgets of up to $40M. A capable mentor and manager, having a track record in multiple organizations, attracting, recruiting, and mentoring teams from 250 to 1,000 employees, establishing the infrastructure that has repeatedly resulted in accelerated performance and led to stock valuation growth. Widely considered a key strategic player and regularly called upon by stakeholders to provide thought leadership in the creation, development, and implementation of mission-critical initiatives with global implications.

profile.title: Chief Executive Officer

experience.title: Corporate Vice President & General Manager, Asia Pacific ACHIEVEMENTS PART 2
experience.description:
ACHIEVEMENTS PART 2

SALES & DISTRIBUTION DEVELOPMENT / RESTRUCTURING
•	Competitors were taking market share, which required a competitive market recapture strategy. Built the team and refocused incentivizes for high-performance. Replaced underperforming distributors, developed new infrastructure, and targeted untapped markets. Expanded sales territories. Delivered 3-year revenue growth rate that outperformed domestic and international competitors.

CHINESE SALES & MARKET SHARE CAPTURE
•	Commissioned to execute a hybrid sales channel in China, where an exclusive distributor and direct sales co-existed. Established an engineering team to support both channels, which reduced the distributor’s costs. Trained sales to target and penetrate untapped markets. Captured the untapped/abandoned customer base, applications, and industries, increasing market share as OEM and Catalog product sales increased, including 20% CAGR from the distributor.

experience.title: Director, Global Supply Chain Management
experience.description:
RESPONSIBILITY PROFILE: Responsible for material sourcing and procurement across 13 facilities in North America and Europe.

ACHIEVED IN THIS ROLE

STRATEGIC PLANNING
•	Tasked by CFO to restore lost global market share, after multiple attempts failed. Devised a 3-phased plan to reduce manufacturing costs and institute new sales practices. This improved on-time deliveries 50% and drove 18% CAGR while reducing costs from $67M to $50M. This provided the critical infrastructure, which supported significant business growth: 18% CAGR in Asia. 32% CAGR growth in China. The Chinese market is projected to achieve continued growth in 2018.

VENDOR SELECTION / NEGOTIATIONS
•	Recruited by the VP of Global Operations to reduce vendor costs 3% ($150M material and budget). Led and executed a plan that analyzed, vetted, and consolidated material purchasing from several thousand to a few hundred suppliers in 18 months. Negotiated contracts, analyzed and defined material portfolios, and delivered 5% material cost reduction while reducing manufacturing costs 25%. This process was duplicated for subsequent acquisitions. Was promoted General Manager of China.

experience.title: General Manager, China Operations
experience.description:
ACHIEVED IN THIS ROLE

PROFIT OPTIMIZATION / COST REDUCTIONS
•	Recruited by VP of Global Operations to reduce manufacturing costs. Moved facilities to China (from US and European facilities) navigating the complications of volume, risk of manufacturing transfer, and quality control. Updated engineering documentation and recruited and trained a new team (1,000 products). This reduced costs 25%, driving $50M profit improvement over 3 years. Was promoted to Corporate VP & GM of Asia Pacific to duplicate this strategy after acquisitions.

OPERATIONAL OPTIMIZATION
•	Recruited by VP of Global Operations to build a world-class manufacturing facility in China, optimize operational efficiencies and quality to global best practices. Recruited team members, led financial analysis, selected a free-trade zone location, and implemented 5S and lean-six sigma. Generated revenue growth, reduced quality issues from 5% to .05%, exceeding US and European facilities, and added 3% profit. This facility qualified by several existing tier-1 US medical and semiconductor customers and new contracts.

ACQUISITION DUE DILIGENCE / INTEGRATION
•	Commissioned by VP of Global Operations to plan and execute a strategy to acquire a competitor and integrate production (#- confidential) and employees (#- confidential) to the Chinese facility, including Complex Class 100 clean room operations, completed within 3 months. Improved quality 50% and production yield from 80% to 99% after acquisition, as well as cutting quality costs in half. These efforts led to increased market share growth and achieved extremely high gross margins (%- confidential) .

experience.title: Chief Executive Officer
experience.description:
CORPORATE PROFILE: A pioneer producer of optical polarization and timing management instruments and solutions for telecommunication, optical sensing, medical, energy, and defense industries.


RESPONSIBILITY PROFILE: Responsible for revenue and profit, optimizing global sales channels, operations, M&A and leading Board of Directors and investors meetings.

ACHIEVED IN THIS ROLE

EBITDA GROWTH / RESTRUCTURING / TURNAROUND
•	Recruited as CEO to bolster employee engagement, improve sales in key markets, achieve consistent on time deliveries and quality. Over a period of 6 months, led a transformation of the US facility to a Lean Six-Sigma manufacturing site for Tier-1 defense and medical customers with over $100M market potential. Reassigned/released underperformers, identified, attracted, recruited, and mentored new leadership and instituted new pricing strategies. These efforts nearly eliminated attrition, reduced costs, improved quality with first time pass, reduced rework labor costs and scrap, and led to profit improvement and new contracts with major industry players, increasing overall profitability.

PRICING RESTRUCTURE
•	Determined  to improve cost structures and gross margins to become more competitive, worked in concert with functional leaders to redefine and institute a new global price list involving. These efforts contributed to sales and profit growth referenced above. Installed discipline and pricing controls, established process and culture for all RFP development, quotes and negotiation.

experience.title: Private Equity Consulting | Operating Partner
experience.description: RESPONSIBILITIES AND ACHIEVEMENTS: Responsible for identifying multiple acquisition targets from $1M to $10M EBITDA. Manage due diligence, negotiations, and lead post acquisition activities, including growth strategies on behalf of private equity investment firms, and serve as interim CEO as directed by the Board of Directors.

education.field_of_study: Business Economics with a Specialization in Computing

profile.name: Gang Lu
profile.headline: President & CEO, GluBio Therapeutics
profile.title: Founder, President & CEO

experience.title: Director, Protein Homeostasis TCoE
experience.description:
I joined Celgene as a senior scientist and moved through positions with increasing responsibility. I was the head of the Molecular Systems Group in the Protein Homeostasis TCoE with specific focus on target identification & validation, MOA and biomarker characterization, and proteomics profiling. Using the state-of-art targeted protein degradation approach, my team aimed at targeting disease-driving proteins for proteasomal degradation to achieve therapeutic efficacy in an array of disease settings. 

Key responsibilities and achievements included the following:

- Built from scratch and manage a 25-person drug discovery team including senior principal scientist, senior scientists, scientist II, scientist I, postdocs and research associates

- Developed and implemented 3 cell-based screen platforms for HT target ID and validation including genome-wide and focused CRISPR screen, barcoded cell-panel CRISPR screen, and high-throughput protein-protein interaction screen.

- Nominated novel drug targets via in-depth validation of drug tractability and disease relevance using customized and standard molecular biotechnology tools and engineered cell lines

- Preclinical project and/or biology lead for 3 small-molecule degrader programs

- Supported the candidate drug nominations and IND filings of  3 small-molecule degraders

- Led the candidate drug nomination and IND filing of 1 small-molecule degrader

- Defined rational combination and explored the mechanisms of drug response and resistance to support the phase I trial of several small-molecule degraders through hypotheses-driven mechanistic studies and unbiased genome-wide CRISPR screen

- Liaised with clinical development teams to align deliverables and scientific objectives

- Published 2 patents and 8 provisional patent applications

experience.title: Research Fellow
experience.description:
I conducted a 5-year postdoctoral training with Nobel Laureate Dr. William G. Kaelin Jr. at the Dana Farber Cancer Institute/HHMI/Harvard Medical School. My research focused on the characterization of the molecular mechanism by which deregulated protein ubiquitination promotes tumorigenesis, and hence provides in-depth knowledge to help design and develop better therapeutics for the treatment of cancer and other human diseases. 

* Established a dual-luciferase protein stability reporter platform to identify novel targets of ubiquitin E3 ligases, deubiquitinase (DUB), or agents that perturb protein degradation.
* Identified two hematopoietic transcription factors, IKZF1 (Ikaros) and IKZF3 (Aiolos), as the target of thalidomide and its analogs, lenalidomide and pomalidomide, collectively called as immunomodulatory durgs, IMiDs. The enhanced degradation of Ikaros and Aiolos by IMiDs is both necessary and sufficient to explain the anti-myeloma activity of IMiDs.
* Discovered oncogenic transcription factors ETS1 and ETS2 as substrates of COP1 E3 ligase, a tumor suppressor focally deleted in a variety of cancer types. Tyrosine phosphorylation of ETS1 by SRC family kinases prevents its recognition by COP1 and thereby promotes ETS1 stabilization, resulting in anchorage independent growth in triple negative breast cancer.


Relevant publication can be found in the following link:
http://scholar.google.com/citations?hl=en&view_op=list_works&gmla=AJsN-F7-8DNcBhcXvOEwXWrBZsL5Ag5sX9A7BWAzyKnJrLnUFTGle7oNb8pMpQBTWUZet188vTEGQTABIByTpyDbBIJ6SmSZRQ&user=O49D5bAAAAAJ

profile.name: Howard Maron
profile.headline: Founder and Physician at MD²
profile.description:
Dr. Maron is the Founder of MD² (pronounced MD Squared). Created in 1996, MD² developed an entirely new conceptual model for primary care medicine, which has come to be known as Concierge Medicine. Prior to founding MD², Dr. Maron ran a prestigious internal medicine practice in Seattle for over 20 years. Dr. Maron was a highly sought-after physician and cared for many of the city’s most distinguished families.  Concurrently, he also served as the team physician to the Seattle Supersonics for over a decade. After completing that tenure he was recruited to be the Medical Director for the Portland Trailblazers where he assembled the future medical team in Portland. 

Inspired by his experience working with the Seattle Supersonics, Dr. Maron felt certain that the concept of the truly personal physician who is responsible for the care of a small group of preferred patients would result in an extraordinary caliber of service. He recognized the potential of this “custom” medical care where the doctor, equipment, pharmaceuticals and staff were all carefully curated to meet each patient’s needs. This was the genesis of MD². 

Dr. Maron graduated from the UCLA School of Medicine. In 1977, he was awarded the UCLA Alumni Association Award for Academic Distinction. He was also awarded membership into the distinguished Alpha Omega Alpha Medical Honor Society. Dr. Maron completed his medical residency training in Internal Medicine at University of Washington Affiliated Hospitals and is certified by the American Board of Internal Medicine. 

Dr. Maron believes that the relationship between a physician and a patient is sacred. It is this conviction that is the inspiration behind his quest to find innovations in the design and development of medical practices.
profile.title: Member Board of Directors

experience.title: Founder and Physician
experience.description:
Founded in 1996, MD² developed an entirely new conceptual model for primary care medicine, which has come to be known as Concierge Medicine. Now spanning the nation and providing patients access to the foremost medical institutions and specialists in the country, MD² is regarded as the preeminent provider of personalized medicine. This is medicine in the ideal. 

Only MD² physicians dedicate their practices to just 50 families. The result is a an unparalleled caliber of care and service bestowed upon their patients and a return to personal service in which relationships are paramount. Dr. Maron has said, "this is healthcare the way it should be, with zero compromises. It's about being cared for in the way you would care for your own family members." 

MD² has medical practices in New York, Boston, Chicago, Dallas, Beverly Hills, San Francisco, Menlo Park, Portland, Bellevue and Seattle and continues to expand into other notable centers of medical excellence.

profile.name: Christian Mulvany
profile.headline: Strategic Media Leader | Broadcast Engineer | Marathon Runner
profile.description:
As the Founder and CEO of Concert·ID, I am driven by a lifelong passion for music and technology. My journey began with a deep love for music, inspired by my father's guitar playing, and has evolved into a dynamic career spanning over 15 years in audio engineering, music production, and broadcast technology.

I hold a Bachelor's degree in Audio Engineering and Music Business from Columbia College Chicago and an MBA from UCLA Anderson School of Management. My diverse background includes roles such as Electronics Engineer at NPR, where I ensure the quality and reliability of broadcast systems for over 40 programs, and Founder of Someation LLC, where I successfully managed and launched several artists' careers, generating substantial revenue and a significant online following.

Throughout my career, I have been dedicated to empowering artists and enhancing fan engagement. At Concert·ID, I lead the development and implementation of a groundbreaking platform that offers recorded concerts within an interactive mobile video game environment. My responsibilities include setting the overall vision and direction for the company, building and maintaining key relationships, guiding product development, leading a talented team, and managing financial planning and fundraising efforts.

My goal is to create a space where artists can showcase their passion for music and benefit primarily from their creations. I am committed to breaking down barriers in the concert industry, providing artists with equitable earnings and fans with unlimited access to high-quality, interactive performances.

With a track record of successfully managing large-scale projects, upgrading infrastructure, and fostering innovation, I am dedicated to leading within creative industries and ensuring that no artist, audience, or individual feels alone. My journey is fueled by a deep belief in the transformative power of music and the shared experience of unconditional love.
profile.title: CEO

experience.title: Electronics Engineer
experience.description:
1) Develop and perform preventative maintenance procedures for fixed and remote broadcast systems utilized by 80 employees over 14 on-site facilities.

2) Ensure the stability of our disaster recovery site by conducting routine testing and failover procedures on our redundant distribution systems for over 40 programs.

3) Create, propose, and implement intuitive documentation to provide staff, spanning across three time zones, the ability to troubleshoot and correct issues without barriers.

experience.title: CEO
experience.description:
As the Founder Concert·ID, I oversee the development and implementation of our platform, which offers recorded concerts within an interactive mobile video game environment.

My responsibilities include:

Strategic Leadership: Setting the overall vision and direction for Concert·ID, ensuring alignment with our mission to democratize concert access and empower artists.

Business Development: Building and maintaining key relationships with artists, industry partners, and investors to drive growth and innovation.

Product Development: Guiding the development and refinement of our platform to enhance user experience and provide unparalleled interactive concert experiences.

Team Management: Leading a diverse and talented team, fostering a collaborative and creative environment that drives our mission forward.

Financial Oversight: Managing financial planning and fundraising efforts to secure the necessary capital for scaling our operations and achieving profitability.

Through Concert·ID, I am committed to breaking down the barriers in the concert industry, providing artists with equitable earnings and fans with unlimited access to high-quality, interactive performances.
